DataElement.preferredName: Participant Other Human Immunodeficiency Virus Risk Group Classification Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the other HIV risk group not previously specified.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Other Human Immunodeficiency Virus Risk Group Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form
